books.author: George Orwell
books.description: In a dystopian society under constant surveillance, a man rebels against the oppressive regime, discovering the power of resistance and the fragility of truth.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: In a futuristic society where stability and happiness are paramount, one man questions the price of conformity and explores the meaning of individuality.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: In a theocratic dystopia, women are reduced to mere vessels for procreation, but one woman finds hope in rebellion and seeks to reclaim her autonomy.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: In a world where books are banned and firemen burn knowledge, one man risks everything to preserve the power of literature and free thought.

books.title: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A farm where animals revolt against their human oppressors turns into a cautionary tale about the corrupting nature of power and the dangers of totalitarianism.

books.title: Neuromancer
books.author: William Gibson
books.description: In the gritty world of cyberspace, a washed-up hacker is hired for a job that thrusts him into a web of corporate intrigue, artificial intelligence, and existential crisis.

books.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.description: In a post-apocalyptic world, a bounty hunter pursues rogue androids and grapples with questions of empathy, identity, and the nature of humanity.

books.title: The Giver
books.author: Lois Lowry
books.description: In a seemingly perfect society devoid of pain and suffering, a young boy discovers the dark truth lurking beneath the surface and embarks on a journey of self-discovery.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, this novel follows the enigmatic Jay Gatsby as he pursues the elusive American Dream and grapples with love, wealth, and the pursuit of happiness.

books.title: Slaughterhouse-Five
books.author: Kurt Vonnegut
books.description: Following the life of Billy Pilgrim, an optometrist who becomes 'unstuck in time' and experiences various moments of his life, including his time as a prisoner of war in World War II and his abduction by aliens.

books.title: Divergent
books.author: Veronica Roth
books.description: In a divided society where people are classified by virtues, one young woman discovers she doesn't fit into any single category, threatening the fragile peace and sparking revolution.

books.title: The Maze Runner
books.author: James Dashner
books.description: Trapped in a mysterious maze with no memory of his past, a teenage boy must navigate deadly challenges and uncover the truth about his existence to escape.

books.title: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: In a post-apocalyptic world ravaged by an unspecified cataclysm, a father and son journey across a desolate landscape, struggling to survive and retain their humanity.

books.title: Lord of the Flies
books.author: William Golding
books.description: Marooned on a deserted island, a group of boys descends into savagery as they grapple with fear, power, and the darker aspects of human nature.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: Following his expulsion from prep school, Holden Caulfield roams the streets of New York City, grappling with alienation, identity, and the phoniness of adult society.

books.title: The Martian
books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: When an astronaut is mistakenly presumed dead and left behind on Mars, he must rely on his ingenuity and wit to survive and signal to Earth that he is alive.
